intro: Coelachyrum annuum, commonly known as the annual coelachyrum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
